image.altText: The frontage of Glenunga International High School

props.synopsis: South Australian police has worked with the national security agency over a "significant" investigation into an 18-year-old man accused of making threats about public events and to an Adelaide school.

title.children: Breaking: Man charged over threats to Adelaide school and events including Gather Round

image.altText: An alleged dangerous driver outside the Christies Beach Magistrates Court.

props.synopsis: A driver who rammed a motorcyclist into a pole during a road rage incident in Adelaide's south, leaving her with life-threatening injuries, has been jailed.

title.children: Road rage driver jailed after leaving woman 'lucky to be alive'

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: South Australia's work safety agency is examining the circumstances surrounding the collapse of a stone wall that claimed the life of a 46-year-old man on a property in the Barossa region.

title.children: Man killed in stone wall collapse in Barossa Valley

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument led to the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: Fried mealworms

props.synopsis: From pet food to waste disposal, insects have many potential uses in Australia. But the industry has to overcome some big challenges around public perception first.

title.children: Squeamish consumers a bit of a problem for edible insect industry

image.altText: A red and white sign reads '2022/23 flood level' with an arrow pointing down to a red line, a dirt levee is behind it

props.synopsis: A damning report reviewing one of South Australia's worst natural disasters in the state's history reflects on how some government agencies could have improved their response.

title.children: SA government agencies 'fell short' in flood response, report finds

image.altText: A group of emergency services personnel stand facing the back of an ambulance with a large white sheet to the left

props.synopsis: The man has been taken to hospital and is in a critical but stable condition.

title.children: Man bitten by shark off SA beach, emergency services say

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta — now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: Repair works on electrical infrastructure.

props.synopsis: Business owners are urged to review their policies after a blackout that took 26,000 properties offline in March. Just one of 70 surveyed traders says their insurance has covered the losses.

title.children: What happens to a small town when the power goes out for 24 hours

image.altText: A young woman holding a drill and sitting on a round table and a middle-aged man standing behind her holding a hammer in a room

props.synopsis: A social media star who purchased her first home during a road trip to outback NSW says renovating it and two other properties with her dad helps her unwind from her busy life.

title.children: TikTok star's outback reno side hustle boosts father-daughter bond

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been arrested over a hit-and-run that claimed the life of a 20-year-old woman in Adelaide's north-east last week.

title.children: Man charged over fatal hit-and-run in Adelaide's north-east

image.altText: Greens leader Larissa Waters

props.synopsis: In one of her first interviews as leader, Larissa Waters tells the ABC of her desire for the next parliament to be more constructive, and have "heart", but says she won't shy away from the tough stance the Greens took on past issues like housing.

title.children: Greens leader Larissa Waters wants 'heart' in new term of parliament

image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that lead to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: A satellite image shows the tops of buildings from above.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a video it released that claimed to show Hamas-built tunnels underneath a southern Gaza hospital actually show different buildings.

title.children: Israel concedes error in video claiming to show Hamas tunnels under hospital

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Sussan Ley and people walking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Three Gen Z Liberals discuss where it went wrong for the party in the federal election and how it can solve "a disconnect" with young people.

title.children: Where it went wrong for the Liberals, according to Gen Z supporters

image.altText: Two young PNG boys stand in front of a pile of rocks, one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: The World Health Ogranization says wild poliovirus type 2 was eradicated in 1999, but the deadly disease has been detected just over 500 kilometres from Australia's northern border.

title.children: A disease Australia wiped out in 2000 has resurfaced in our closest neighbour

image.altText: Go-Jo on stage with arms out, red scarf and blue jumpsuit with billowing smoke around him

props.synopsis: Marty Zambotto, 29, known as Go-Jo, gyrates across the Eurovision Song Contest stage in the second semifinal, but fails to make the cut.

title.children: Australia misses Eurovision final for second year in a row

image.altText: A slim elderly man in light blue shirt and glasses walks towards the camera outside a building on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A woman who survived sexual abuse at the hands of a convicted paedophile former priest fears he will hurt her again if the Timor-Leste government succeeds in having him pardoned.

title.children: 'The man should die in jail': Dili considers proposal to pardon 'evil' former priest

image.altText: A man in a black button-up shirt looks animated while speaking with a microphone in hand

props.synopsis: The US president has cast doubt over the meeting between officials from Kyiv and Moscow producing any significant progress on ending the three-year conflict.

title.children: Russia-Ukraine peace talks in jeopardy, Zelenskyy says Russia 'not serious'

image.altText: A poor quality photo of a man with a knife on an escalator, taken from above.

props.synopsis: The Bondi Junction stabbing inquest has revealed numerous "concerning" red flags in Joel Cauchi's behaviour.

title.children: Bondi killer asked girls' school to let him watch swim carnival and netball

image.altText: Albanese in a suit and tie with a big smile shakes hands with Prabowo who is also wearing a suit and looking happy.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese urges Australian businesses to show greater "ambition" when dealing with the emerging South-East Asian economy.

title.children: PM promises stronger ties with Indonesia, dodging doubts about Russia

image.altText: A white man in a suit stands in front of a screen with a series of days and weather, pointing to it

props.synopsis: Increasingly complex technology means forecasts are significantly better than they were decades ago — here's why.

title.children: How many days ahead can the weather be accurately predicted?

image.altText: Two people walk past a steel sign reflecting in the sunlight that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Australia's RBA is meeting on Tuesday, but relatively strong wages and jobs data could see the board cut rates by less than some predicted. NAB is sticking by a forecast of half a per cent. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: NAB sticking by 'super-sized' RBA rate cut forecast for next Tuesday

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: NAB sticking by super-sized RBA rate cut forecast
Japan's economy shrinks by surprising amount

image.altText: Cam Davis hits his tee shot with an iron, watching the ball in flight

props.synopsis: Australian Cam Davis has a share of second place after the first round of the US PGA Championship, with compatriot Adam Scott three strokes behind.

title.children: Davis tied second after first round of US PGA Championship

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: From party leadership votes to missing ballot papers and plunging spacecrafts to luxury aeroplanes, this week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new Liberal leader, a luxury aeroplane and Eurovision

image.altText: rocket in vertical position at night

props.synopsis: Gold Coast-based Gilmour Space Technologies had been given a two-week window clearance to launch its 23-metre Eris rocket from a purpose-built pad in north Queensland.

title.children: 'A big bummer': Launch of Australia's first home-grown rocket delayed again

image.altText: Kaden Groves sitting in the saddle of his race bike, smiling with his arms outstretched, winning a stage of the GIro d'Italia.

props.synopsis: Australian sprinter Kaden Groves triumphs on the sixth stage of the Giro d'Italia, on a dramatic day when the race is neutralised after a huge crash on the 227km ride from Potenza to Naples.

title.children: Groves wins Giro stage as fellow Aussie forced into ambulance after crash

image.altText: A woman in a red dress with red painted nails toasting a man with champagne.

props.synopsis: In the 'sugar dating' world, attractive young women date rich older men to facilitate the kind of romance you pay for. But things can go wrong when sex mixes with money, wealth and power.

title.children: What life is like as a sugar baby who dates older men

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and purple tie while holding his hands out speaking behind a microphone in front of US flags

props.synopsis: The US President made the claim while also criticising tech giant Apple's decision to invest in India, following the implementation of his tariff regime.

title.children: Trump says India has offered 'no tariffs' on US goods in trade negotiations

image.altText: trees on roof of house with holes

props.synopsis: When a ferocious storm tore through this small Gippsland town, residents did not wait for government help to rebuild — they helped themselves. Here's how they did it.

title.children: What do you do when your town is destroyed? Ask locals in Mirboo North

image.altText: A person tries to pick up a fence that is leaning over in a big puddle.

props.synopsis: Floodwater has receded and paddocks are drying across western Queensland, revealing thousands of kilometres of damage that will take years to rebuild.

title.children: 'Great Australian fence hunt' underway as western Queensland rebuilds

image.altText: Two possumlike animals crawling along a eucalypt branch at night.

props.synopsis: Three hours north of Brisbane, a group of greater gliders is living in a section of the St Mary State Forest set to be logged, despite them being a protected species.

title.children: 'My heart sank': Forest home to endangered gliders pegged to be logged

image.altText: Tim Wilson

props.synopsis: Queenslander Larissa Waters emerged as the second woman to lead the federal Greens, beating out South Australian Sarah Hanson-Young and Mehreen Faruqi.

title.children: Tim Wilson waits anxiously as Australia's political conclaves conclude

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: A juror has been discharged from the Erin Patterson trial, after reports emerged that he had been discussing the case with family and friends.

title.children: Juror dismissed in mushroom murder trial
